<h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   JOIN US IN POWERING CHANGE\n   <br> We are looking for graduates who share our purpose to power progress and our culture of inclusion, collaboration, and care. We’ll give you the support you need to forge your own path, and you’ll have real responsibilities and meaningful projects to work on right from the start.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHERE YOU FIT IN\n   <br> Shell’s purpose is to power progress together, by providing more and cleaner energy solutions. We believe that rising standards of living for a growing global population are likely to continue to drive demand for energy, including oil and gas, for years to come. At the same time, technology changes and the need to tackle climate change means there is a transition underway to a lower-carbon, multi-source energy system.\n   <br> As one of the world’s leading energy companies, Shell plays a key role in meeting the world’s growing energy demand in economically, environmentally, and socially responsible ways. There has never been a more exciting time to be part of the energy industry. Join us in our ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, and sooner if that is possible.\n   <br> \n   <br> In China, Shell builds on its over-120-year-long history to help fuel the Chinese Dream in the “New Era”. The mission of Shell China is Powering Progress, Powering a Net-zero Emissions Future. Against the backdrop of China’s 14th Five-Year-Plan and 30-60 carbon ambitions, Shell China will keep customers in the center of everything we do, set the roadmap of our energy transition journey and provide lower-carbon energy solutions to meet our customers’ needs of decarbonization through integration of our products, services and solutions. We are keen to collaborate with customers, suppliers and partners to explore innovative low-carbon business opportunities, drive sustainable development and make contributions to the low-carbon future of China.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHAT’S THE ROLE?\n   <br> Our Graduate Programme is a rigorous development framework of specific competences, business-critical capabilities, and critical experiences that will enable you to become a competitive professional by the end of your 3-year programme.\n   <br> Right from the start, you will be given a challenging hands-on role, working in a diverse, global environment. You will be supervised and mentored with frequent reviews as part of a structured development programme. You will also be learning alongside brilliant people from all over the world, with the resources and support to explore new ways of thinking and working – all in all, an unbeatable experience.\n   <br> We know that learning is key to developing yourself both personally and professionally. The graduate programme encompasses a learning framework that includes internal and external courses, as well as on-the-job learning, designed to help you gain the skills you need to succeed.\n   <br> \n   <br> WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU\n   <br> You should enjoy being challenged, so that rather than being daunted or overwhelmed if a task seems impossible, you welcome the opportunity to be innovative. You also need to be good at absorbing information, analysing problems, making objective decisions, and coming up with original ideas. You should have the drive, and resilience to get things done, the flexibility to work well as part of a team and the credibility to influence others.\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To be eligible for the Shell Graduate Program, you should be in your final year of study or have less than certain years of relevant work experience.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>You must at least have a Bachelor’s degree or in your final year of Bachelor’s study.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> Join the Shell Graduate Programme and Power Change from Day One.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <p>Customer Operations is in its journey to provide the best in market customer experience for our Customers and Business Partners in Shell. We create the great place for commercially minded individuals who thrive working with customers and who want to growth their experience in agile, digital and e-commerce initiatives.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> We have a collaborative, flexible, dynamic and very supportive working culture; where every single one of us is determined to make a difference, to go the extra mile because it’s our job, every day, to make our customers’ experiences with Shell that little bit better. We highly value a Diversity &amp; Inclusion. Want to bring more – JOIN US!<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Customer Success Specialist (CSS) is empowered to manage customer experience, relationship and satisfaction across the end-to-end journey of our customers. This job sits across the Deal Management and Order to Cash forming a critical part of the Customer Fulfilment Cycle. It delivers end-to-end customer support, from contract and account set-up, through to order and payment. CSS provides Consistent, Adaptive, Reliable and Easy experiences to our customers.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What’s the role? <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p>As a Customer Success Specialist, you will be accountable for a certain customer portfolio to take ownership, drive accountability, and demonstrate and communicate improvements for our customer journey. This is a key enabler to drive best-in-class CX and to ensure maximum customer-centricity.<\u002Fp>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p> This role may focus on some or all the accountabilities below, depending on the respective business size and complexity:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><b> Deal Management<\u002Fb> (accountable for Bid and Tender, Contract Management, Pricing, Master Data, Data Integrity Management, enforcing company’s policy and contracts, Ensuring compliance)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p><b> Order to Cash<\u002Fb> (responsible for Order Management, Touchless Support and Set-up, Dispute Management, Credit Management, ensuring invoices are correct and paid on time, Building strong relationships and creating partners (customers) for life, understand customer’s issues and to drive resolution and improvements)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p><b> Sales Support<\u002Fb> (Manage existing customer portfolio of business, Manage customer relationship virtually, Analyst P&amp;L reports and identify, manage areas of underperformance, Champion the SPANCOP sales process with a strategic mindset, Manage key sales process steps as agreed with respective business, Data-driven sales recommendation)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n      <p><\u002Fp>\n      <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <p> Critical to the success of this role is to demonstrate strong Customer Language Proficiency and experience in managing Customer Relationship and Customer Success.<\u002Fp>\n      <p> Additionally, you will have:<\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Working proficiency in English<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Strong Communication and Influencing skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Previous experience in data Analytics &amp; Insights and Digital environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Demonstrated ability and commitment to build Customer Success<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Knowledge of Customer Centric Design<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> A good understanding of Commercial &amp; Economic Acumen and Value Chain methodology<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> The ability to lead and drive Continuous Values<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Attention to details when dealing with Data Management and high focus on Compliance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Proven experience in Contract Management<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell's story in China dates back more than 100 years. At Shell China we will make sure that your ideas will travel. All of Shell’s core businesses are now represented in China. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. regular products in daily work, and assist technical team on product formulations optimization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Provide QC training\u002FDeliver technical\u002Ftest procedure training to new staff to meet competence requirement,<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop QC processes and procedures to ensure necessary quality control points in place<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Responsible in plant sample management and to be the focal point of Lab equipment maintenance and assist in HSSE check\u002Fmaintenance record<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This is a key role to realize our offshore wind ambition in China. We’re therefore looking for someone who loves learning, strives, is highly motivated, seeks challenge, driven, committed to improvement, and highly determined.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The successful candidate will need to be comfortable with challenging conventional thinking and approaches to arrive at innovative, pragmatic and effective solutions and ways of working to overcome the challenges and to seize the opportunities inherent to building a new business in an industry that is new to China.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specifically, the following requirements are must haves:<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Ability to speak, read and write Mandarin Chinese at native level and fluency in English.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Bachelor’s or Master’s degree education, an MBA is an advantage.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Substantial experience in deal making and joint venture partnership formation with SOEs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Substantial experience in renewable power generation\u002Foffshore wind development in a joint venture setting, ideally you have supported the development of an offshore wind farm before from origination to commissioning.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Significant understanding of the evolving China power market structure, corporate power purchase agreements, renewable energy certificates and offshore wind regulatory framework.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Perseverance and ability to cultivate strong positive working relationships internally and externally to get things done.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Exposure to developing investment cases and having the resilience and resourcefulness to overcome challenges.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><b><br> More about Shell in China<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell's story in China dates back more than 100 years. At Shell China we will make sure that your ideas will travel. All of Shell’s core businesses are now represented in China. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell's story in China dates back more than 100 years. At Shell China we will make sure that your ideas will travel. All of Shell’s core businesses are now represented in China. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> If you want to play a role in China’s energy transition, then this might be the perfect opportunity for you!<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where <\u002Fb><b>y<\u002Fb><b>ou <\u002Fb><b>f<\u002Fb><b>it <\u002Fb><b>i<\u002Fb><b>n<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell Real Estate (RE) manages Shell Group's Real Estate portfolio, Shell Business Operations and Corporate Travel Programme. Strategic intent is to enable Shell Businesses to deliver on their goals by creating safe, secure, and productive environments that allow people to perform at their best.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The rapidly growing Shell RE scope is one of the globe's largest RE portfolios and includes offices, industrial \u002F labs and accommodation for Shell Businesses, Projects, and Ventures. We contribute to Shell's world class investment case by driving a cost-competitive real estate portfolio, and more sustainable footprint through improved energy efficiencies and more renewable power.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell's RE team of professionals has established a strong reputation as mature Corporate Real Estate organization, delivering portfolio strategies, commercial transactions, capital projects, facility and business operations services and travel support to the various Shell Businesses and Functions in all parts of the world. Therefore, RE continues to seek the best talent across Shell to become part of our team, and to help us meet these dynamic and growing business needs.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Real Estate services in Shell are delivered through a few regional main contracts, ie. Facilities Management, Road Transport, Travel and local contracts ie. Construction. Your role as Real Estate (RE) Contract Performance Manager (CPM) is to Support Facilities Manager (FM) China &amp; Japan on development and implementation of pre- and post- award contract performance management. You will also be managing Facilities for sites across China for Mobility business.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key Roles and Responsibilities:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Developing the draft contract scope, defining the scope boundaries with site input; Developing contractor HSE management and site service requirements in support of procurement activities for regional and local contracts in liaison with Contracting &amp; Procurement team; participate in technical evaluation of contractors’ tender proposals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Co-ordinate the mobilisation of new contracts including the establishment of the site level contract management action plans (CMP), and LFOC (local form of contract) where applicable.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Manage and provide assurance on contract risks including safety and contract financial planning; Ensuring contracts are managed within approved contract values. Manage contract variations, claims, disputes, termination etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop, implement, and monitor Site performance data, facilitate strategic\u002Ftactical-level contract performance reviews based on contract KPIs on HSE, Quality, Cost, Schedule and Sustainable Development; Business Controls and support Continuous Improvement activities with support from the SBO team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Participate annual budget review, monitor spending under main contracts and make appropriate and timely adjustment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Analyse the pool of existing local contractors and make sure the contractor pool has the right capability, capacity (area coverage), and commercial competitiveness to support both current and future needs. Play advisory and assurance role on contracting strategy for non-routine FM work<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> For directly managed sites, supervise site FM staff, and Provide visible HSSE leadership and management of local HSSE arrangements to deliver Goal Zero; Manage full range of service contracts and manage local procurement on RE related activities; Develop annual business plan and budget pan<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will thrive in:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Providing a healthy balance of support and challenge to the Site Managers<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Driving contract value by developing proper contracting strategy for various RE services; proactively seek opportunity and lead continuous improvement initiatives<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Managing multiple sites scattered geographically in China; Deliver an acceptable level of services in a cost constrained environment<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You are someone who can bring out the best in others, maximize performance, integrate, and collaborate across boundaries. Soft skills required from you include the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong collaboration skills to lead and foster leadership quality throughout teams and ability to work effective with teams from Shell external strategic partners<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> A Learner Mindset – Role model curiosity and reflection; learn from mistakes and successes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maximize performance – Integrate and collaborate across boundaries to maximize commercial value for Shell as a whole<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are keen to hear from individuals who have a formal University qualification in Real Estate, Business Administration, or Finance or with professional Real Estate accreditation or equivalent; preferably with 5-8 years’ work experience in commercial and industrial real estate facilities management or managing major service contract.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Beyond that, we’d hope to see as many of the following as possible on your CV.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Contract management and proven working experience with external strategic partners is essential, including defining contract scope, identifying risks, managing supplier relationships, performance measurement and improvement<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Have strong Health, safety, and environment leadership and can demonstrate a track record on safety performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proven track record in business partnering, good stakeholder relationships and management with ability to influence at GM level.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in financial planning including budget planning, monitoring, and reporting<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Business acumen to understand the economics of a solution or service, including cost drivers and the trade-offs associated with quality, schedule, and cost.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent in Mandarin and English (speaking and written)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Background<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The energy transition requires the development of new business opportunities for Shell, together with the development of new technologies and equipment-based solutions. An important part of this strategy is the assessment and development of CVPs and technologies to electrify current and future assets across industrial sectors. Electrification is one of the key enablers to achieve deep industrial decarbonization, next to other technologies such as CCS, biomass or H2.<br> <\u002Fp>\n  <p><br> <b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><br> Under the VP Power Technology you will report to a Team leader in the GM E-Mobility Technology team. You will be part of an organization that promotes and supports the use of renewable electrical power to replace fossil based energy in industrial processes. The team includes a wide range of experts over the different areas of electrification and the various uses of renewable power to decarbonise industrial processes.<br> <br> <\u002Fp>\n  <p><b>What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The E-Mobility Project Leader drives realisation of maximum commercial value from Shell proprietary, or 3rd Party, electrification technology through co-developing scalable commercial &amp; business models that enable Shell to capture the most material parts of the integrated value chain. The role will initially lead E-Mobility Technology Projects in China in support of China commercial business functions AND support more global E-Mobility project enabled by access to Chinese technology and partners.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Delivering on those business models will require partnerships with OEMs, delivery parties and\u002For (digital) technology owners. A critical part of the Project Leader role is to leverage learning and capability from the Power Technology team AND to transfer knowledge, learning and insight from China.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Key interfaces will be with the China Sector &amp; Decarbonization Mobility and Lubricants Businesses respectively, and the wider VP-Power Technology organization.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Strong affinity and experience with deployment of new technology solutions in traditional and new market segments including experience in battery technology and\u002For heavy-duty mobility sectors or similar experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deep understanding of the overall energy system from both the supply and consumer side, including how technology drives electrification trends, and market implications of technology adoption<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Extensive experience in technology commercialization and business model innovation including familiarity with Business Case development.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in contracting and managing IP for technical collaborations with third-parties including start-ups, universities, corporate research, research consortia, national labs, major technology companies etc.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capable of developing a broad internal and external network to stay abreast of the latest developments<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Capable of effective and impactful communications across topics, audiences, and formats at all organizational levels<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Customer centricity, as evidenced by product development &amp; technology commercialization<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> An ability to deal with ambiguity, uncertainty and transformation, as this is a very dynamic new business area (for Shell) without established boundaries and with an above average amount of (organizational) growth and hence change<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Enable Industry standards development with partners, mainly including understanding of related standards existing or to be developed; Identify the parts that could be disruptive to the industry; Experience of participating in, influencing or leading standard establishment is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support market and technology intelligence gathering and analysis. Maintain review of related technologies, e.g. fast charging, industrial robotics, solid-state batteries, etc., Support business decisions of market entry in related areas from the value chain.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understand the market trend of different related technology paths, able to propose and develop new CVP with business team leveraging technology expertise.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Use your understanding of power markets, regulatory frameworks, industrial energy needs, and current &amp; emerging electrical technologies to support the assessment, development &amp; deployment of electrification solutions for the decarbonization of industry.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will bring extensive electrical power experience in China to identify, mature and tailor commercial solutions for domestic industrial markets. Through your experience and networks in the Chinese electrical industry, and associated research communities, you will identify and leverage capabilities to support the development of electrification technologies and supply chains for global industrial applications.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> More specifically, you will be entrusted to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Maintain knowledge of current and emerging electrification technologies for industrial applications.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Screen China based start-ups and other technology focused small and medium sized companies to identify leading technologies for the development of electrification solutions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead Chinese supplier identification and supply chain set-up in support of domestic and global product delivery.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Maintain a deep knowledge of power markets, regulatory frameworks and industrial energy needs in China.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Support the development of CVPs and business models for electrification solutions in industrial applications for the Chinese market.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Identify product and solution deployment opportunities in China.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Continued commitment to deliver HSSE excellence for personnel and operations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> A master’s degree or higher from a leading institution in electrical Job requires a solid understanding of R&amp;D standard principles. Applies standard R&amp;D techniques or procedures to assigned tasks.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Coordinates activities performed by subcontractors and suppliers.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Engages with one or more (groups of) internal and external (i.e. research \u002F academic institutions) stakeholders on operational level. Scale and severity of consequences if things go wrong is limited, involving some stakeholder management.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Design activities concentrate on standard topics (directed by standards and procedures).<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n   <br> This job profile contains generic information and does not describe individual positions or required job competencies. Grading decisions will also depend on other factors.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Position description - Purpose<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p> The Global Commercial Technology Group (PTX\u002FL) within P&amp;T is the technology department of the Shell Global Commercial Business and operates from major Technology hubs and Technical Centers in the US, Europe and Asia. The primary focus of the Global Commercial Technology Group is the delivery to the Business of the agreed R&amp;D and Technical Support program. An important activity within Lubricants Technology is the delivery of Grease development and technical service, with the aim to help the Business grow.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> The Grease Technology Project Leader, independently plans and executes aligned product development and technical service support. Such that they are on time, in scope and in budget, including any “in-flight adjustments”, to enable the Lubricants business within DS Global Commercial to achieve goal zero, top line growth through Technology Leadership, building on innovation, market share positions and opportunity pipeline.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Position description - Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> in alignment with the relevant Technology Manager, independently plans and executes globally agreed and approved product development and technical service projects, on time, in scope and in budget, including “in-flight adjustments”.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> lead product ideation, from formulation development to manufacturing design, support the implementation in grease plants especially in China and AP region.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> solve failure diagnosis and troubleshooting following technical service processes, develop ‘Reason to Believe’ to support business<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Is seen as an expert by direct colleagues coaching and guiding colleagues on project related work, as part of delivering the annual global R&amp;D and TS program<\u002Fli>\n     <li> contribute in creating lubricants\u002Fgreases intellectual property and secure freedom of action<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages the relationship with multiple (groups of) internal and external stakeholders (including research \u002F academic institutions) on tactical level to enhance the company’s leadership position in the marketplace<\u002Fli>\n     <li> liaise with product stewardship, product technology, and product management teams to ensure the quality of Shell’s finished lubes\u002Fgreases meets industry requirements, customers’ satisfaction, and supports our Technology Leadership positioning<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely with the business team in China to develop new business opportunities and broaden the applications of greases in emerging sectors to support organic growth pipeline<\u002Fli>\n     <li> complete technical evaluation, develop technology partnership to support inorganic growth (acquisition \u002F JV)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> proactively plan, coordinate, and supervise activities performed by subcontractors and suppliers (including COGS \u002F performance advantage of raw materials)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Works within company standards and policies under defined directions while receiving occasional guidance on techniques and signals non-compliance<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Master’s degree or above in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or other related scientific field<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Over 3-year experience of R&amp;D in Lubricant Industry<br> Deep Knowledge and\u002For technical expertise in finished lubricant\u002Fgrease formulation development, testing, and application<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge and preferably skill with project management, and capable of leading R&amp;D\u002FTS activities with planning and opex\u002Fcapex budgetary responsibilities<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong track record in managing internal and external stakeholders, providing independable product development and technical support at all times, and serving on cross-functional teams<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Vigilant with Safety\u002FHSSE mindset while performing any activities at all times<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Demonstrated evidence of Enterprise First values and behaviors as well as Leadership Attributes (authenticity, growth, collaboration, performance) will be taken into account during the selection process.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Shell Catalyst and Technologies (SC&amp;T) has an opening for a Technical Service Engineer (TSE) to support its residue hydroprocessing catalyst business. In this role, the individual will provide technical support for Fixed and Ebullated Bed resid units including performance estimates, loading and start-up, unit monitoring and troubleshooting.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> This role reports to the Senior Technical Solutions Manager Resid and is based in China, Singapore, or India.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Purpose<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> SC&amp;T is a customer facing organization that brings high value, differentiated technologies to the market. These technologies include a portfolio of hydroprocessing catalysts from its refining catalyst line. The TSE role supports the sale of these catalysts through their entire lifecycle by providing best-in-class technical service. The role is highly customer focused, requiring commercial skills in addition to technical capabilities. Our culture in SC&amp;T is one of Humility, Curiosity, Commercial Excellence, Determination, but above all putting the customer first.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The TSE will be accountable for providing technical and sales support associated with resid hydroprocessing catalyst customers. They will be a member of a global technical support team and will work closely with sales on specific customer accounts. Specific role functions include:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Develop catalyst performance estimates and complex technical proposals in response to customer requests<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Support customers during catalyst loading, activation, and start-up<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Add value to customer operations via unit monitoring, data analysis, case studies and troubleshooting<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Build collaborative working relationships with customer’s technical staff, achieve a position of trusted advisor with the customer<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Gather key insights on customer needs and drivers and competitive feedback from market<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Document successes that customers achieve with SC&amp;T catalysts and technical support and share knowledge gained from these successes within the organization, helping to further strengthen SC&amp;T’s technical and commercial positions<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n   <li> 5 – 8 years’ experience in refinery technical, operations or planning or in hydroprocessing technology delivery (process design, licensing)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong technical and problem-solving skills with the ability to diagnose unique and challenging operational issues<\u002Fli>\n   <li> High degree of confidence with the ability to earn the trust of experienced and knowledgeable refinery personnel<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Good command of spoken and written English<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Strong commercial skills in the area of 4D (discover, diagnose, develop, deliver)<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Ability to travel 30% of the time<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Organizational skills to multi-task and manage several projects and customers at the same time<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Translated Company Description <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Additional Information:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Seeking person with strong HSSE track record, proven process engineering skills, and commercial mindset. Desire person who takes initiative and handles multiple priorities well. Strong interpersonal skills and willingness to work with others are essential for success in this role.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Prefer person with experience in 2 or more refinery areas and at least one of the following applications: Resid Hydroprocessing, Hydrocracking or Diesel\u002FVGO Hydrotreating<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p>Head of Onshore Power China is accountable for all Onshore Power activities in the country and delivering the Onshore Power market strategy and business plan for the country.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We will entrust you with the following:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Management of Onshore Power China business and in-country personnel.<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Hire, develop, mentor and retain high-performing individuals.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Monitor and report on the performance of team via tools such as Salesforce. Review business on quarterly basis to assess strategy and performance against key metrics.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Maintain support for the country strategy and its implementation from Onshore Power and Renewables Generation (RG) line management.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Demonstrate visible leadership and care for HSSE.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Be a credible and compelling spokesperson for Onshore Power and the wider Shell Renewables and Energy Solutions (SRE&amp;S) group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and obtain endorsement on a multi-year business plan for China, including inorganic strategy and partnerships; headline investment size; targeted annual capex, MWp and GWh; business financial performance; Onshore Power resourcing; and more.<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p> Lead all market entry activities (inorganic and\u002For organic) for Onshore Power into China.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Manage identification and screening of renewable power companies for prospective investment and acquisition of capability at scale.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Manage ORS process from Onshore Power perspective in order to deploy capital and grow the business.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Manage project development and execution: surface rights, project development for specific projects by managing the permit application process towards regulatory authorities including local stakeholder management, grid connection feasibility and applications, and bring projects to NTP and FID. Work with EPC management function to bring individual projects to Commercial Operation Date (COD). Work with operations and maintenance (O&amp;M) and asset management functions for ongoing project performance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Work with Shell lines of business to achieve integration value and to serve Shell customers.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> University degree; Master’s in business administration (MBA) preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> 10-15 years’ experience in renewable power business development, project development, and\u002For investments, or in commercial leadership roles and lines of business with transferrable skills and experience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Track record in originating, negotiating, developing, and closing investment opportunities.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of the solar, wind, and battery storage market in China, including competitive landscape and market rules and regulation preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in greenfield development activities: negotiating and concluding land lease agreements with landowners or their representatives, coordinating site specifics with financial and technical colleagues and lead optimization, managing the permit application process towards regulatory authorities, managing grid connection point identification, feasibility studies, and application process, etc. preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Proficient in renewable power project economics, value chain and drivers; and in project development strategy and execution, value drivers and risks and mitigations preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience working with Chinese State-Owned Enterprises a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in business-to-business sales a plus.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluent or proficient in Mandarin Chinese and English.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong Commercial acumen. Proficient in writing business proposals, pitching business cases, and public speaking.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to work collaboratively and lead effectively across multi-functional teams and interface with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders, based in various locations, whilst maintaining a high work level of work ethic and being able to work autonomously.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Culturally sensitive and ability to build strong relationships with Shell, partners and stakeholders.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Ability to build and motivate teams to drive performance improvement.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Willingness and ability to work against challenging targets in what can be a continuously changing external environment and in which deals under development will be ‘firsts.’<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Can-do attitude; be a self-starter; patience and resilience.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Able to travel for work.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell in China<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell's story in China dates back more than 100 years. At Shell China we will make sure that your ideas will travel. All of Shell’s core businesses are now represented in China. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Shell\u002FShell Group companies around the world. The Shell Group and its approved recruitment consultants will never ask you for a fee to process or consider your application for a career with Shell. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <div>\n  <p><b>Job Purpose &amp; Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Provide product application specialist (PAS) expertise on grease applications in the Auto Components, Bearing Manufacture OEM, General Industry (Robot , Pneumatic tool ), Construction, Transport, Cement, Power (esp. Wind Power), Metal, Mining ( Grease and open gear lubrication) and other B2B sector customers to enable business growth, increase share of wallet, and premium penetration and develop deeper technical intimacy. The key focus will be in growing the grease volumes and margin generation with global key accounts in addition to customers in direct and indirect channels. Another key requirement in this role is to drive the competence development of front line technical and sales teams in their ability to identify and deliver on opportunities for reducing Total Cost of Ownership(TCO), increase Shell Gadus grease volumes and generate revenue from associated services such as Shell LubeExpert. Work together with global and regional marketing teams, grease product triangle and product application specialist teams to review and develop the sector specific CVP for greases across multiple sectors including product development pipeline. Transfer and aggregate strategic and operational technical knowledge between Technology, global product management and operational portfolio management teams to front line technical and sales teams, including knowledge received from and passed to, OEMs and customers, being both a proactive and reactive information channel and provider of training and coaching to Shell technical staff ( LTA team). The PAS role is both reactive to customer problems (upon escalation from front line staff) and proactive in developing internal and external relationships, coaching front line staff and providing marketing support such as assisting with new product launches and field trials. Ensure that all work undertaken complies with Shell HSSE, Life Saving rules, and Quality Management systems and develop best practices for LSE community globally.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b> Dimensions <\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Contribute to implementation of 2022 Plus Ultra growth project to attain sales &amp; margin aspiration to deliver 13k tons Grease &amp; 19.5 million USD C3 &amp; 1.5 USD\u002Fkg unit C3 in China\u002F HK market by end 2022<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Manage Technical relationship with critical direct customers and Bearing OEMs in China – but also support indirect customers as required by business priority.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b><br> Boundaries:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The PAS does not sell product or have sales targets and does not call on customers unless requested by customer relationship owners. However it is expected that the successful candidate will have strong commercial mindset and be able to independently prioritize and identify business<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful> opportunities. Requests in support of grease BDM and front line sales to ensure issues are\n   <br> handled by PAS. Where the development of technical relationships e.g. with key accounts such as OEMs requires the PAS to have regular contact with a specific customer, the PAS is responsible for ensuring the commercial owner of that OEM account is aware of in advance, and kept up to date with this contact.\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <div>\n   <b><br> Skills &amp; Requirements<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Technical qualification to BSc degree level or higher in mechanical engineering, chemistry, chemical engineering is preferred.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Relevant experience (&gt;5 years) of Grease product application and services implementation in field with customers is a key requirement.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience in maintenance of mobile and fixed plant including open gear systems, cement mills\u002Fkilns, excavators and fixed plant from steel, mining, cement and wind power sectors, and in utilising the Shell LubeExpert service to deliver TCO savings to customers.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>A sound understanding of the various techniques related to the condition monitoring approach and of lubrication systems, their fault diagnosis and installation will be well regarded.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proven ability to manage customer expectations and build relationship with mutual trust and technical credibility.<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Experience of leading, coaching, motivating &amp; developing a team<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proven ability to work in teams (local and virtual)<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Proven communications skills, written and verbal – ability to converse and develop technical communications in English and sound handling of English language (written and spoken).<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <b><br> Additional Information Key competencies required:<\u002Fb>\n   <br> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Applying technical capability - Mastery<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Applying Customer value proposition – Mastery<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Generating Insights- Mastery<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Technical Knowledge: Expertise and Communication - Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Project Management, Execution &amp; Deployment – Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Innovation – Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Intellectual Property &amp; Knowledge Management -Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Business Context, Technology Strategies &amp; Commercial Mindset – Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Maximizes Business Opportunities - Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Managing Customer Experience – Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Displays personal effectiveness – Skill<\u002Fli>\n    <li>Key account management - Skill<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <br> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will support multiple research projects and activities in energy storage related research and development programmes, as well as developing broader topical, project, and market expertise related to various forms of energy storage. More specifically, in this role you will:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Support identification of promising storage technologies and development of these through the Shell Deliver Technology Process; discovering\u002Fevaluating, developing\u002Fpiloting, demonstrating and deploying towards commercial scale.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Establish working knowledge of techno-economic analysis to place technology developments in appropriate context.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Deliver lab &amp; pilot projects, often in multi-party collaborations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop and expand laboratory capabilities and experimental procedures; identify\u002Fdevelop\u002Fimplement tools for data acquisition and analysis.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Develop understanding of the broader energy system, the energy transition, &amp; the role of emerging technologies; evaluate external technologies for technical and economic viability and potential, and place technology developments into appropriate contexts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Contribute to results published in peer-reviewed publications, internal technical reports, conference presentations, and patent filings.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Represent Shell in relevant academic and industry platforms and present at conferences.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> What we need from you<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated commitment to safety, health, and environmental considerations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience with energy storage technologies and the role of energy storage in electrification<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Understanding of energy storage technology from an electrochemistry\u002Fmaterials science perspective and from a system design\u002Fintegration perspective<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Effective stakeholder management with technical and non-technical collaborators<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Direct experience with laboratory setup and experimental techniques relevant to electrochemical energy systems; experience with extending or developing novel techniques is beneficial<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Design, synthesis, functionalization, &amp; characterization of electrically active materials; material structure-property relationships; device fabrication &amp; characterization; influence of manufacturing on performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience translating customer &amp; market needs into technical requirements<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Consumer + systems thinking<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Translating end user product requirements into relevant, robust, critical-to-quality process parameters<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Product design and prototyping (physical and computational)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Working knowledge of intellectual property (IP) considerations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Project leadership and laboratory supervisory experience<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Demonstrated commitment to R&amp;D as evidenced through technical presentations and publications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> PhD in materials science, chemical engineering, chemistry, physics, or related field. Experience with electrochemical engineering and electrochemically active materials is a plus<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> You are keen to keep learning and persistent towards your end goal<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> More about Shell<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Energy transition is one of the most complex challenges to ever face humankind. Research has shown that the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think are crucial to deliver top performance. Diversity in all aspects is core to our ways of working including our hiring practices and we are committed to build a team and environment that accelerates the path towards a net zero society.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. entity focuses on non-traditional business. The Finance Manager (FM) shall partner General Manager (GM) in delivering the entity’s business target and realise business growth. Besides business delivery with compliance, the incumbent is expected to engage and maintain relations with various internal and external stakeholders. This position reports directly to FM Lubricants China, and meanwhile, is responsible to entity GM.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What is the role?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role has accountability to deliver the full range of finance capability for required functional activities and independent business decision support with a proper control framework and high-quality performance management systems in place.<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Being a trusted Business Partner of the entity GM and Management Team on financial matters and management of value\u002Frisk, keep abreast of market dynamics and changes.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li> Planning and Appraisal. Drive financial planning and appraisal. Generate timely Management Information (MI) to support decision making and achieving the business goal.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Governance, Assurance and Controls. Support Management Team to implement assurance programs, promote compliance culture and behaviour. Ensure that the risk-based control framework is implemented, and that sound controls are embedded, coordinate risk assessment and mitigation actions.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Accounting and Reporting. Ensure data integrity for all accounts and comply with PRC GAAP and reporting requirements by Laws and Shell Group.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Business development support. Conduct Finance review and challenge of investment proposals. Provide finance review and support for operating plans. Partner with Management Team on business plan formulation and implementation. Ensure cost discipline. Closely monitor related risks and mitigation when supporting rapid business growth.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> ERP. Implement fit-for-purpose ERP to be effective in control, compliance, automation and efficiency.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Taxation. Ensure compliance of tax regulations\u002Flaws. Take appropriate approach to apply tax incentive\u002Fexemption programs granted by governments where applicable.<\u002Fli>\n   <li> Treasury. <h2 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>The Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fh2> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <p>This role is a challenging position with excellent development opportunities across Trading &amp; Supply and the wider Shell group. Shell supplies around 3% of the energy the world uses and expects to play its part in contributing to the global effort to tackle climate change. This role is at the sharp edge of that challenge, requiring a confident and self-motivated individual with a strong passion for pursuing Shell’s Net Carbon Footprint ambition.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We are interested in attracting people to our business who share our core working values of honesty, integrity and have respect for others. We also want those who can build on our business vision, are prepared to accept accountability and can achieve great results through teamwork.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Where you fit in<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role is as a Portfolio Delivery Manager within the Environmental Products Trading Business (EPTB). You will be expected to manage a portfolio of carbon credit generating projects. You will be working in a rapidly evolving business area, often in challenging regulatory and legal environments, requiring you to be agile and perform well under pressure.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> You will be a part of a global team of capable and motivated individuals and as such, will benefit from the ability to work and form relationships with a diverse set of individuals.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What's the role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> The Portfolio Delivery Manager will be an integral part of the EPTB team leading the due diligence, review and feasibility of carbon projects for EPTB. This role reports to the Global Market Development manager based in Amsterdam.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> The role will require you to:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Key contributor in maximising the gross margin of the global business, being prepared to share time, expertise and resource across deals that are often global in reach<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead the development of new projects fungible into regulated markets (key focus) and\u002For voluntary markets where opportunities exist.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead end to end processes from ideation to execution which adds Gross Margin and value to the Global EPTB book. This involves working closely with the commercial team, project developers and project owners to oversee feasibility assessment including testing of assumptions, developing models, creation, and submission of project design documents (PDD), registration, verification, and validation of projects in line with standards and chosen methodology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead relationship with Standard(s) and third parties to seek clarity and answer questions about the project(s), gather information when<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Guide the team through providing methodological advice and insights for current &amp; future projects<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead and initiate site visits where appropriate and attend verifications to oversee performance, milestones and enhance project risk awareness.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Accountable to ensure all projects have the required up to date accreditation.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Work closely with the Deal Management team to investigate issues which may influence project delivery and performance<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Lead relationships in China with key standards, universities\u002Fthink tanks, keep up to date on the latest developments on the key Global GHG standards (, JCredits, JCM, KOC’s amongst others) and share the interpretation of such developments on the impact on the Global P&amp;L and portfolio with the team.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Conduct research on papers written by third parties (Universities, think tanks), trends, and when necessary, work with them to explore new methodologies which add value to the Global book<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Follow best practice in the engagement and interaction with counterparties, ensuring all desk activities comply with financial and market regulations as well as Shell’s Code of Conduct and Compliance manual.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> What we need from you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We require a detailed oriented individual with excellent project management skills and capable of contributing to the team ethos. Working under tight deadlines and conflicting pressures, the candidate will prove able to continue delivering to an excellent standard, with clear focus on the priorities in hand.<\u002Fp>\n  <p> Candidates are required to have a wide set of multidisciplinary skills including:<\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> Degree in Environmental Sciences, Sustainable Forest Management, Environmental Governance or equivalent<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Knowledge of global Emissions Trading Schemes and the fundamental drivers of these.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience of managing portfolios with accountability for volume forecasts, delivery forecasts and methodology review<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Carbon accounting including implementing environmental projects, applying program and methodology requirements in the nature and non-nature space<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Experience in audit and assurance processes<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong commercial awareness<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Attention to detail, excellent communication &amp; presentation skills<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Strong demonstration of Shell’s Code of Conduct<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> Fluency in the English and Mandarin essential, other languages desirable<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> Company description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Shell's story in China dates back more than 100 years. At Shell China we will make sure that your ideas will travel. All of Shell’s core businesses are now represented in China. We need world-class candidates to continue our drive to innovate and answer the world’s energy needs in socially and environmentally responsible ways.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An innovative place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> Join us and you’ll be adding your talent and imagination to a business with the ambition to shape the future – whether by investing in oil, gas and renewable energy to meet demand, exploring new ways to store energy, or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently, everyone at Shell does their part.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> An inclusive place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>To power progress, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we are nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills, and reach your potential.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <ul>\n   <li><p> We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n   <li><p> We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p><b> A rewarding place to work <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n  <p>Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.<\u002Fp>\n  <p><\u002Fp>\n  <p> We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.<\u002Fp>\n  <br> \n  <p><\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><p>Disclaimer <\u002Fp><\u002Fh3>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Anyone who demands such a fee is not an authorised Shell representative and you are strongly advised to refuse any such demand. Shell is an Equal Opportunity Employer.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n
